p: The amount of tannins differed significantly depending on the solvent medium, obtaining minor concentration for the methanol extract in comparison to the aqueous extract ( Table 1). The concentration of tannins presented by the Jacaranda mimosifolia flowers is lower than those presented by other types of hibiscus flowers (2849.4 ± 121.1 and 4420.9 ± 110.7 mg CE/100 g DW), and Cassia flowers (1779.8 ± 139.2 and 103.3 ± 6.9 mg CE/100 g DW for ethanol and aqueous extracts, respectively) ( Mak et al., 2013). The same trend is observed for Limonium delicatulum flowers for methanol and aqueous extracts (48.38 ± 0.70 and 8.14 ± 0.44 mg CE/g DW, respectively) ( Medini et al., 2014), presenting higher values than these of flowers of J. mimosifolia. The presence of tannins can contribute to the elimination of free radicals depending on the number of aromatic rings, molecular weight, and nature of the hydroxyl group substitution ( Cai et al., 2006).
